intro: Acianthopsis tenuilabris, commonly known as the slender-lipped acianthopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Acianthopsis tenuilabris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky slopes.
